metadata.title: CVE-2021-32728 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The Nextcloud Desktop Client is a tool to synchronize files from NextcloudServer with a computer. Clients using the Nextcloud end-to-end encryptionfeature download the public and private key via an API endpoint. Inversions prior to 3.3.0, the Nextcloud Desktop client fails to check if aprivate key belongs to previously downloaded public certificate. If theNextcloud instance serves a malicious public key, the data would beencrypted for this key and thus could be accessible to a malicious actor.This issue is fixed in Nextcloud Desktop Client version 3.3.0. There are noknown workarounds aside from upgrading.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-nextcloud - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
dolphin-nextcloud - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
libnextcloudsync0 - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nautilus-nextcloud - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nemo-nextcloud - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nextcloud-desktop - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nextcloud-desktop-cmd - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nextcloud-desktop-common - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
nextcloud-desktop-l10n - 3.6.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nextcloud-desktop package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-2ubuntu1').
